item.title: Anti-skid System – Complete System Inoperative (2 or More Channels)

numlitem.para: AOM CH. 5.1 anti-skid inoperative decrements are applied for anti-skid inoperative operations, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed with a brake deactivated and the anti-skid system inoperative.

numlitem.para: Use Takeoff Runway Limit Worksheet/Anti-skid Inoperative Procedures, respective to engine type, in Chapter 5.1 of the AOM.
Autobrakes will not be available. Do not select RTO.
Use the whole runway for stopping consistent with conditions.
When stopping after landing and for rejected takeoffs, utilize reverse thrust to the maximum extent possible and raise speedbrakes.
Initiate wheel braking using very light pedal pressure and increase as ground speed decreases. Exercise greater caution during light weight landings, normal brake pressure may lock wheels.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA, TGU.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
V1 Reduction and comparison to VMCG required (see AOM Chapter 5.1).
Apply Airport Analysis Anti-skid Inoperative weight correction.
Landing Weight Reduction – see destination airport landing chart for Max Landing Weight with anti-skid system inoperative.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard ANTI-SKID light "SYSTEM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Anti-skid System Inoperative (2 or More Channels)
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: PREFERRED PROCEDURE (2 or more channels inoperative): This allows for anti-skid protection on the operative channels to minimize tire/brake wear.

para.emphasis: Deactivate the inoperative channels using BITE check:

numlitem.para: Gain access to anti-skid/autobrake control unit located E1-1 shelf in the main equipment center.
Note all faults by pressing BIT until TEST END.
Clear faults by pressing RESET.
Note recurrent faults by pressing BIT until TEST END.
Open and collar circuit breakers for channels that display fault codes XDCR____ or BOX____.
Select AUTO BRAKES OFF.
ALTERNATE PROCEDURE: Dispatch with all anti-skid channels inoperative (2 or more channels inoperative).
Open and collar the four anti-skid channel circuit breakers:
Select AUTO BRAKES OFF.
